SENT.plain: Since 1994, we have treated 62 cases with hyperacute cerebral embolism with local intraarterial thrombolysis (LIT), but not all cases showed recanalization
We tried to classify these cases by angiographic results
Angiographically they could be classified into four types; tapering type, fading type, stump type, and edge type
The tapering and fading type had a significantly higher tendency to recanalize than the stump and edge type
We think these classifications indicate the dissolubility of the cerebral emboli; the former two types dissoluble, the latter two types indissoluble
The tapering and fading type are the good indicators for LIT, but the stump and edge type may not be
